case_vignette: An 8-year-old girl is brought to the physician by her parents because they are concerned with her behavior. She has temper outbursts six or seven times per week, which last anywhere between 5 minutes to half an hour or until she becomes tired. According to her father, she screams at others and throws things in anger “when things don't go her way.” He says these outbursts started when she was 6 and a half years old and even between the outbursts, she is constantly irritable. She had been suspended from school three times in the past year for physical aggression, but her grades have remained unaffected. She appears agitated and restless. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. During the mental status examination, she is uncooperative and refuses to answer questions.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis in this child?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I have frequent temper outbursts about six or seven times a week, lasting from a few minutes to half an hour until I get tired. I also feel constantly irritable and I'm generally uncooperative, especially when things don’t go my way.
How old are you?
I am 8 years old.
Do you experience any difficulty in school, such as problems with focusing or following instructions?
No, my grades have remained unaffected despite my behavior issues.
Have you experienced any significant changes or stressors in your home or school environment recently?
No significant changes or stressors in my home or school environment have been mentioned.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms since I was 6 and a half years old.
Final Diagnosis: Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD)

This child also experiences constant irritability and generally displays uncooperative behavior, especially when things don’t proceed as expected. Despite these behavioral issues, the child’s academic performance remains unaffected. No significant changes or stressors in the home or school environment have been reported. These symptoms have been occurring since the child was 6 and a half years old.
